column18:
Your photos should meet the following criteria:



1) They are photos that you've already posted to your Instagram account; please blur out/crop out your personal instagram handle. 

2) They evoke positive feelings only

3) They are original photos posted by you (not re-posts, memes, or quotes originally posted by someone else)

4) They do not contain any inappropriate or illegal content (revealing clothing, nudity, drug paraphernalia, expletives, or politically charged content, bullying or other types of offensive material)

5) They are photos and not screenshots of videos

6) Of the 30-35 photos, please have at least 5 photos that include yourself

7) They are not from a business or professional account

8) Do not upload any duplicates of the same photo, each photo must be different. If duplicates are detected, you may be ineligible to participate in the study.



Please confirm your understanding of the above requirements:
column19:
Adelphi University Informed Consent




Principal Investigator:         Dominic Fareri, Ph.D.

                                                

Research Purpose

The goal of this study is to begin to better characterize how our value of choice and decision-making is affected by social contexts. 



Description of the Research

You will be asked to take part in a computerized task in which the photographs you include and upload as part of your participation in the study will be shared with an anonymous partner(s). You will receive feedback from your partner(s) after your photos are shown. The feedback may come in the form of liked or disliked. Any photos submitted to the study will be immediately discarded upon completion of the study. You will then be given the option to make a series of choices in a lottery game or decline and have the computer participate in the task on your behalf. You will also be asked to complete a series of self-report questionnaires which may ask about your social experiences, personality and substance use either at the beginning or end of the session. The study will be broken up into two parts: in the first, you will be asked to complete a series of questionnaires and upload a series of photos off of your Instagram account; in the second part, you will complete a computerized task and post-task questionnaires.



Your participation in each part of this study will last between 40 minutes and 1.5 hours, depending on how quickly you complete the tasks.



Potential Risks

There are no known risks associated with your participation in this study.  You may experience mild discomfort from performing a computer task for up to one hour (i.e., strained eyes); however, there will be rest periods during the course of the experimental session to mediate any discomfort of this sort. You are able to withdraw from participation at any time if you feel any discomfort at all without penalty to you. 



Potential Benefits

There are no direct benefits to you for participating in this study.  Your participation will help us

understand how we are affected by different social contexts and how this may influence subsequent decisions. The findings from this set of studies may be helpful in understanding how social influence can have both positive and negative effects on our behavior, as well as our emotional and mental well-being.



Costs/Compensation

You will receive compensation for your participation in this study in the form of monetary compensation at the rate specified when you entered into the survey online on Prolific (e.g., between $5-$10 per hour).  You may also be eligible for bonus pay based on your choices and successfully completing the task.



Additional Information

Contact Persons

If you have any questions, at any time, about this research, or want to discuss any

possible study-related injuries, please contact Dr. Dominic Fareri at telephone number

516-877-4824.  If you experience any distress as a result of participation in this study, you may

seek out additional assistance by contacting Adelphi University’s Student Counseling Center

at 516-877-3646, located in the University Center, Rm 310.  You can also contact the Adelphi 

University Center for Psychological Services at 516-877-4820, located in the Hy Weinberg

Center. 



Confidentiality

Your identity as a participant in this research study will be kept confidential in any publication of the results of this study. The information obtained during this research (research records) will be kept confidential to the extent permitted by law. However, this research record may be reviewed by government agencies (such as the Department of Health and Human Services), the agency sponsoring this research, individuals who are authorized to monitor or audit the research, or the Institutional Review Board (the committee that oversees all research in human subjects at Adelphi University) if required by applicable laws or regulations.  The material will be maintained for up to 7 years. 



All data from this study will be stored on a password-protected computer and securely backed up on a password-protected external drive. Only the PI and designated personnel on the research team will have access to participants’ data.  All participants will be given a unique identifier to ensure confidentiality.  The key linking participants’ unique identifier and any protected information will be kept in a locked file cabinet separately from any data.  Only the PI and designated members of the research team will have access to this key. 



Voluntary Participation

Participation in this study is voluntary. You will be able to terminate your participation in this

study at any time with no penalty to you. 



Institutional Review Board Approval

This research has been reviewed and approved by the Adelphi University Institutional Review Board.  If you have any questions, concerns or comments, please contact the IRB chair, Dr. Carolyn Springer, 516-877-4753, springer@adelphi.edu.
